intro: Baeckea crassifolia var. pentamera, commonly known as the Five-lobed Baeckea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a shrub characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. The species belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. Its flowers are typically arranged in dense, spherical inflorescences and bloom during the spring and summer months. The plant is often found in sandy or rocky soils in coastal and inland regions of southern Australia.
